lemmatized.description: lemmatized text of the detected relation action

confident.description: will return "no" if categorization doesn't meet confidence standards

score.description: confidence score for the detected category 0.0 .. 1.0 (higher is better)

census.description: sameAs link to the US Census

ciaFactbook.description: sameAs link to the CIA World Factbook

geo.description: latitude longitude - geographic coordinates associated with this result.

relevance.description: relevance score for a detected concept tag. 0.0 .. 1.0 (higher is better)

website.description: the website associated with the result

census.description: sameAs link to the US Census

ciaFactbook.description: sameAs link to the CIA World Factbook

geo.description: latitude longitude - geographic coordinates associated with this result

website.description: the website associated with the result

anger.description: probability that the text implies anger

disgust.description: probability that the text implies disgust

fear.description: probability that the text implies fear

joy.description: probability that the text implies joy

sadness.description: probability that the text implies sadness

mixed.description: whether sentiment is mixed (both positive and negative) (1 == mixed)

count.description: number of times an entity was seen within the source text

relevance.description: relevance score for a detected entity. 0.0 .. 1.0 (higher is better)

date.description: The extracted date in yyyymmddThhmmss format

text.description: The text of the date as it appears in the source text

score.description: confidence score for the detected image keyword 0.0 .. 1.0 (higher is better)

relevance.description: relevance score for a detected keyword. 0.0 .. 1.0 (higher is better)

typeHierarchy.description: path through the knowledge graph to the appropriate keyword

date.description: will be in the form of YYYYMMDDTHHMMSS

quotation.description: quotation extracted for a particular named entity

text.description: Excerpt from the source text that corresponds with this result

mixed.description: whether sentiment is mixed (both positive and negative) (1 == mixed)
whether sentiment is mixed (both positive and negative) (1 == mixed)

score.description: the sentiment score (0.0 - 1.0) directed towards the object

type.description: the sentiment polarity directed towards the object

text.description: Excerpt from the source text that corresponds with this result

anger.description: probability that the text implies anger towards the target

disgust.description: probability that the text implies disgust towards the target

fear.description: probability that the text implies fear towards the target

joy.description: probability that the text implies joy towards the target

sadness.description: probability that the text implies sadness towards the target

score.description: Confidence score between 0 and 1. The higher the score, the greater the confidence

sentence.description: Text from the document that contains the relation

part.description: The argument's part in the relation. For example, an award might be the "first" part in an "awardedTo" relation

text.description: Text from the input that describes the argument

id.description: Unique identifier for the detected entity

text.description: Text from the input that describes the entity

negated.description: whether this action verb was negated in the detected relation - 1 = negated, 0 = not negated

tense.description: tense of the detected action verb - past, present, future

text.description: lemmatized base form of the detected action verb

info.description: The AlchemyLanguage API uses natural language processing technology and machine learning algorithms to extract semantic meta-data from content, such as information on people, places, companies, topics, facts, relationships, authors, and languages.
info.title: IBM Alchemy Language

anchorDate_formData.description: The date to use as "today" when interpreting phrases in the text like "next tuesday." Format: `yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss`
anchorDate_formData.name: anchorDate

anchorDate_query.description: The date to use as "today" when interpreting phrases in the text like "next tuesday." Format: `yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss`
anchorDate_query.name: anchorDate

coreference_formData.description: Set this to 0 to ignore coreferences (he, she, it, etc) for entities
coreference_formData.name: coreference

coreference_query.description: Set this to 0 to ignore coreferences (he, she, it, etc) for entities
coreference_query.name: coreference

cquery_formData.description: Visual constraints query to use when sourceText is set to cquery
cquery_formData.name: cquery

cquery_query.description: Visual constraints query to use when sourceText is set to cquery
cquery_query.name: cquery

disambiguate_formData.description: Set this to 0 to hide entity disambiguation information in the response
disambiguate_formData.name: disambiguate

disambiguate_query.description: Set this to 0 to hide entity disambiguation information in the response
disambiguate_query.name: disambiguate

entities_formData.description:
Set this to 1 to identify entities in detected relations
This incurs an additional API transaction
entities_formData.name: entities

entities_query.description:
Set this to 1 to identify entities in detected relations
This incurs an additional API transaction
entities_query.name: entities

extractLinks_formData.description: Set this to 1 to include hyperlinks in the extracted web page text
extractLinks_formData.name: extractLinks

extractLinks_query.description: Set this to 1 to include hyperlinks in the extracted web page text
extractLinks_query.name: extractLinks

extract_formData.description:
Comma separated list of analysis features:
  • authors
  • concepts
  • dates
  • doc-emotion
  • entities
  • feeds
  • keywords
  • pub-date
  • relations
  • typed-rels
  • doc-sentiment
  • taxonomy
  • title
extract_formData.name: extract

extract_query.description:
Comma separated list of analysis features:
  • authors
  • concepts
  • dates
  • doc-emotion
  • entities
  • feeds
  • keywords
  • pub-date
  • relations
  • typed-rels
  • doc-sentiment
  • taxonomy
  • title
extract_query.name: extract

jsonp_formData.description: JSONP callback (requires 'outputMode' to be set to 'json')
jsonp_formData.name: jsonp

jsonp_query.description: JSONP callback (requires outputMode to be set to json)
jsonp_query.name: jsonp

keywords_formData.description:
Set this to 1 to identify keywords in detected relations
This incurs an additional API transaction
keywords_formData.name: keywords

keywords_query.description:
Set this to 1 to identify keywords in detected relations
This incurs an additional API transaction
keywords_query.name: keywords

knowledgeGraph_formData.description:
Set to 1 to include knowledge graph information in the results
Incurs an additional API transaction
knowledgeGraph_formData.name: knowledgeGraph

knowledgeGraph_formData_combined.description: Include knowledge graph information in the results for each applicable function in the combined call. This incurs one additional transaction for each function involved.
knowledgeGraph_formData_combined.name: knowledgeGraph

knowledgeGraph_query.description:
Set to 1 to include knowledge graph information in the results
Incurs an additional API transaction
knowledgeGraph_query.name: knowledgeGraph

knowledgeGraph_query_combined.description: Include knowledge graph information in the results for each applicable function in the combined call. This incurs one additional transaction for each function involved.
knowledgeGraph_query_combined.name: knowledgeGraph

linkedData_formData.description: Set this to 0 to disable linkedData links in the response
linkedData_formData.name: linkedData

linkedData_query.description: Set this to 0 to disable linkedData links in the response
linkedData_query.name: linkedData

maxRetrieve_formData.description: maximum number of results to return for each extract function
maxRetrieve_formData.name: maxRetrieve

maxRetrieve_formData_concepts.description: maximum number of concepts to return (default 8)
maxRetrieve_formData_concepts.name: maxRetrieve

maxRetrieve_formData_entities.description: maximum number of entities to return (default 50)
maxRetrieve_formData_entities.name: maxRetrieve

maxRetrieve_formData_keywords.description: maximum number of keywords to return (default 50)
maxRetrieve_formData_keywords.name: maxRetrieve

maxRetrieve_formData_relations.description: maximum number of relations to return (default 50, max 100)
maxRetrieve_formData_relations.name: maxRetrieve

maxRetrieve_query.description: maximum number of results to return for each extract function
maxRetrieve_query.name: maxRetrieve

maxRetrieve_query_concepts.description: maximum number of concepts to return (default 8)
maxRetrieve_query_concepts.name: maxRetrieve

maxRetrieve_query_entities.description: maximum number of entities to return (default 50)
maxRetrieve_query_entities.name: maxRetrieve

maxRetrieve_query_keywords.description: maximum number of keywords to return (default 50)
maxRetrieve_query_keywords.name: maxRetrieve

maxRetrieve_query_relations.description: maximum number of relations to return (default 50, max 100)
maxRetrieve_query_relations.name: maxRetrieve

metadata_url_formData.description: Input here will appear in the url field in the response
metadata_url_formData.name: url

metadata_url_query.description: Input here will appear in the url field in the response
metadata_url_query.name: url

model_formData.description:
Unique identifier for a custom model. By default, one of the following models are used depending on the language of the source text:

  • en-news
  • es-news
  • ar-news
model_formData.name: model

model_query.description:
Unique identifier for a custom model. By default, one of the following models are used depending on the language of the source text:

  • en-news
  • es-news
  • ar-news
model_query.name: model

quotations_formData.description: Set this to 1 to return quotations associated with detected entities
quotations_formData.name: quotations

quotations_query.description: Set this to 1 to return quotations associated with detected entities
quotations_query.name: quotations

requireEntities_formData.description: Set this to 1 to only report relations that contain at least one entity
requireEntities_formData.name: requireEntities

requireEntities_query.description: Set this to 1 to only report relations that contain at least one entity
requireEntities_query.name: requireEntities

sentimentExcludeEntities_formData.description: Set this to 1 to exclude entity name text from sentiment analysis (for example, do not analyze "New" in "New York")
sentimentExcludeEntities_formData.name: sentimentExcludeEntities

sentimentExcludeEntities_query.description: Set this to 1 to exclude entity name text from sentiment analysis (for example, do not analyze "New" in "New York")
sentimentExcludeEntities_query.name: sentimentExcludeEntities

sentiment_formData.description:
Set this to 1 to return sentient information for each detected result
Incurs an additional API transaction
sentiment_formData.name: sentiment

sentiment_query.description:
Set this to 1 to return sentiment information for each detected result
Incurs an additional API transaction
sentiment_query.name: sentiment

showSourceText_formData.description: Set this to 1 to include the original source text in the API response (default 0)
showSourceText_formData.name: showSourceText

showSourceText_query.description: Set this to 1 to include the original source text in the API response (default 0)
showSourceText_query.name: showSourceText

sourceText_formData.description: Method used to obtain the source text from the HTML file (default cleaned_or_raw)
sourceText_formData.name: sourceText

sourceText_query.description: Method used to obtain the source text from the HTML file (default cleaned_or_raw)
sourceText_query.name: sourceText

structuredEntities_formData.description: Set this to 0 to ignore structured entities, such as Quantity, EmailAddress, TwitterHandle, Hashtag, and IPAddress
structuredEntities_formData.name: structuredEntities

structuredEntities_query.description: Set this to 0 to ignore structured entities, such as Quantity, EmailAddress, TwitterHandle, Hashtag, and IPAddress
structuredEntities_query.name: structuredEntities

targets_formData.description: Pipe delimited list of target phrases (must be URL encoded) - sentiment targeted towards these phrases will be analyzed
targets_formData.name: targets

targets_formData_emotion.description: Pipe delimited list of target phrases (must be URL encoded) - Emotion Analysis will be performed on the phrases in the context of the source text
targets_formData_emotion.name: targets

targets_query.description: Pipe delimited list of target phrases (must be URL encoded) - sentiment targeted towards these phrases will be analyzed
targets_query.name: targets

targets_query_emotion.description: Pipe delimited list of target phrases (must be URL encoded) - Emotion Analysis will be performed on these phrases in the context of the source text
targets_query_emotion.name: targets

useMetadata_formData.description: Set this to 0 to ignore webpage metadata in the source text
useMetadata_formData.name: useMetadata

useMetadata_query.description: Set this to 0 to ignore webpage metadata in the source text
useMetadata_query.name: useMetadata

xpath_formData.description: XPath query to use when sourceText is set to xpath
xpath_formData.name: xpath

xpath_query.description: XPath query to use when sourceText is set to xpath
xpath_query.name: xpath

get.description: Date extraction identifies dates that are mentioned in text. You can specify an anchor date to accurately interpret dates like "next tuesday."
get.summary: Extracts dates from an HTML document

post.description: Date extraction identifies dates that are mentioned in text. You can specify an anchor date to accurately interpret dates like "next tuesday."
post.summary: Extracts dates from an HTML document

get.description: The HTMLGetAuthors call is utilized to extract author information contained within the specified web page. AlchemyLanguage will process the posted HTML document, looking for author information.
get.summary: Retrieves author information from an HTML document

post.description: The HTMLGetAuthors call is utilized to extract author information contained within the specified web page. AlchemyLanguage will process the posted HTML document, looking for author information.
post.summary: Retrieves author information from an HTML document

get.description:
HTMLGetCombinedData lets you combine multiple AlchemyLanguage HTML operations into a single API call. Concept, keyword, entity, and taxonomy operations are performed by default if no 'extract' parameter is specified.

Any of the parameters that can be passed in the individual extract methods can be passed in a combined call, but they will apply to any applicable features that are specified in the extract parameter. For example, if you pass knowledgeGraph=1 in a combined request for concepts, entities, keywords, and relations, you will add a total of 4 extra transactions to the request.
get.summary: Analyzes HTML with multiple AlchemyLanguage operations

post.description:
HTMLGetCombinedData lets you combine multiple AlchemyLanguage HTML operations into a single API call. Concept, keyword, entity, and taxonomy operations are performed by default if no 'extract' parameter is specified.

Any of the parameters that can be passed in the individual extract methods can be passed in a combined call, but they will apply to any applicable features that are specified in the extract parameter. For example, if you pass knowledgeGraph=1 in a combined request for concepts, entities, keywords, and relations, you will add a total of 4 extra transactions to the request.
post.summary: Analyzes HTML with multiple AlchemyLanguage operations

get.description: Detects document-level emotion conveyed by the source text. Returns scores for anger, disgust, fear, joy, and sadness.
get.summary: Analyzes the emotion conveyed by text from an HTML document

post.description: Detects document-level emotion conveyed by the source text. Returns scores for anger, disgust, fear, joy, and sadness.
post.summary: Analyzes the emotion conveyed by text from an HTML document

get.description: Identifies and returns RSS/ATOM feed links found in an HTML document.
get.summary: Extracts RSS/Atom feeds from HTML

post.description: Identifies and returns RSS/ATOM feed links found in an HTML document.
post.summary: Extracts RSS/Atom feeds from HTML

get.description: The HTMLGetMicroformatData call is utilized to extract microformat content from a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will process the posted HTML document, looking for a variety of microformats data structures (hCards, geo, adr, etc.).
get.summary: Extracts microformat data from an HTML document

post.description: The HTMLGetMicroformatData call is utilized to extract microformat content from a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will process the posted HTML document, looking for a variety of microformat data structures (hCards, geo, adr, etc.).
post.summary: Extracts microformat data from an HTML document

get.description: The HTMLGetPubDate call is utilized to extract publication date information contained within the specified web page. AlchemyLanguage will process the posted HTML document, looking for publication date information.
get.summary: Retrieves publication date information from an HTML document

post.description: The HTMLGetPubDate call is utilized to extract publication date information contained within the specified web page. AlchemyLanguage will process the posted HTML document, looking for publication date information.
post.summary: Retrieves publication date information from an HTML document

get.description: The HTMLGetRankedConcepts call is utilized to extract a relevancy-ranked list of concept tags for a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform concept tagging operations.
get.summary: Returns concepts found in an HTML document

post.description: The HTMLGetRankedConcepts call is utilized to extract a relevancy-ranked list of concept tags for a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform concept tagging operations.
post.summary: Returns concepts found in an HTML document

get.description: The HTMLGetRankedKeywords call is used to extract a relevancy-ranked list of topic keywords from a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform keyword extraction operations.
get.summary: Extracts keywords from an HTML document

post.description: The HTMLGetRankedKeywords call is used to extract a relevancy-ranked list of topic keywords from a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform keyword extraction operations.
post.summary: Extracts keywords from an HTML document

get.description: Date extraction identifies dates that are mentioned in text. You can specify an anchor date to accurately interpret dates like "next tuesday."
get.summary: Extracts named entities (people, companies, etc) from an HTML document

post.description: The HTMLGetRankedNamedEntities call is used to extract a grouped, relevancy-ranked list of named entities (people, companies, organizations, etc.) from a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform entity extraction operations.
post.summary: Extracts named entities (people, companies, etc) from an HTML document

get.description: The HTMLGetRankedTaxonomy call is used to categorize a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text and other important content from the posted HTML document structure and perform document categorization operations. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform taxonomy classification operations.
get.summary: Categorizes the content of an HTML document

post.description: The HTMLGetRankedTaxonomy call is used to categorize a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text and other important content from the posted HTML document structure and perform document categorization operations. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform taxonomy classification operations.
post.summary: Categorizes the content of an HTML document

get.description: The HTMLGetRawText call is utilized to extract all text from a posted web page. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure, including page navigation, advertisements, and other page content. To ignore this content, please use the HTMLGetText call.
get.summary: Extracts all text from an HTML document

post.description: The HTMLGetRawText call is utilized to extract all text from a posted web page. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure, including page navigation, advertisements, and other page content. To ignore this content, please use the HTMLGetText call.
post.summary: Extracts all text from an HTML document

get.description: The HTMLGetRelations call is utilized to extract Subject-Action-Object relations from a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform relation extraction operations.
get.summary: Extracts Subject-Action-Object relations from an HTML document

post.description: The HTMLGetRelations call is utilized to extract Subject-Action-Object relations from a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform relation extraction operations.
post.summary: Extracts Subject-Action-Object relations from an HTML document

get.description: Searches the source text for specified target phrases and analyzes the emotions that they convey. Returns scores for anger, disgust, fear, joy, and sadness.
get.summary: Analyzes the emotion conveyed by target phrases from an HTML document

post.description: Searches the source text for specified target phrases and analyzes the emotions that they convey. Returns scores for anger, disgust, fear, joy, and sadness.
post.summary: Analyzes the emotion conveyed by target phrases from an HTML document

get.description: The HTMLGetTargetedSentiment call is utilized to extract positive/negative sentiment targeted towards a specific user-specified target phrase inside the text of a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform sentiment analysis operations.
get.summary: Returns sentiment information for specified phrases in an HTML document

post.description: The HTMLGetTargetedSentiment call is utilized to extract positive/negative sentiment targeted towards a specific user-specified target phrase inside the text of a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform sentiment analysis operations.
post.summary: Returns sentiment information for specified phrases in an HTML document

get.description: The HTMLGetText call is utilized to extract the primary page / article text from a posted web page. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure, ignoring page navigation, advertisements, and other undesirable page content.
get.summary: Extracts primary text from an HTML document (avoids advertisements and other undesirable content)

post.description: The HTMLGetText call is utilized to extract the primary page / article text from a posted web page. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure, ignoring page navigation, advertisements, and other undesirable page content.
post.summary: Extracts primary text from an HTML document (avoids advertisements and other undesirable content)

get.description: The HTMLGetTextSentiment call is utilized to extract positive/negative sentiment from a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform sentiment analysis operations.
get.summary: Returns sentiment information for an HTML document

post.description: The HTMLGetTextSentiment call is utilized to extract positive/negative sentiment from a posted HTML document. AlchemyLanguage will extract text from the posted HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform sentiment analysis operations.
post.summary: Returns sentiment information for an HTML document

get.description: The HTMLGetTitle call is utilized to extract title information from a posted web page. The posted HTML document is processed, extracting any title information.
get.summary: Extracts title information from an HTML document

post.description: The HTMLGetTitle call is utilized to extract title information from a posted web page. The posted HTML document is processed, extracting any title information.
post.summary: Extracts title information from an HTML document

get.description: Identifies entities in text and returns different types of relations that exist between them. For example, the entities "Oscar" and "Leonardo DiCaprio" might be linked by an "awardedTo" relation. To tailor results to your domain, you can specify your own custom entities and relations with custom models in Watson Knowledge Studio
get.summary: Identifies relations between entities found in HTML content

post.description: Identifies entities in text and returns different types of relations that exist between them. For example, the entities "Oscar" and "Leonardo DiCaprio" might be linked by an "awardedTo" relation. To tailor results to your domain, you can specify your own custom entities and relations with custom models in Watson Knowledge Studio
post.summary: Identifies relations between entities found in HTML content

get.description: Date extraction identifies dates that are mentioned in text. You can specify an anchor date to accurately interpret dates like "next tuesday."
get.summary: Extracts dates from text

post.description: Date extraction identifies dates that are mentioned in text. You can specify an anchor date to accurately interpret dates like "next tuesday."
post.summary: Extracts dates from text

get.description:
TextGetCombinedData lets you combine multiple AlchemyLanguage text operations into a single API call. Concept, keyword, entity, and taxonomy operations are performed by default if no 'extract' parameter is specified.

Any of the parameters that can be passed in the individual extract methods can be passed in a combined call, but they will apply to any applicable features that are specified in the extract parameter. For example, if you pass knowledgeGraph=1 in a combined request for concepts, entities, keywords, and relations, you will add a total of 4 extra transactions to the request.
get.summary: Analyzes text with multiple AlchemyLanguage operations

post.description:
TextGetCombinedData lets you combine multiple AlchemyLanguage text operations into a single API call. Concept, keyword, entity, and taxonomy operations are performed by default if no 'extract' parameter is specified.

Any of the parameters that can be passed in the individual extract methods can be passed in a combined call, but they will apply to any applicable features that are specified in the extract parameter. For example, if you pass knowledgeGraph=1 in a combined request for concepts, entities, keywords, and relations, you will add a total of 4 extra transactions to the request.
post.summary: Analyzes text with multiple AlchemyLanguage operations

get.description: Detects document-level emotion conveyed by the source text. Returns scores for anger, disgust, fear, joy, and sadness.
get.summary: Analyzes the emotion conveyed by text

get.description: Identifies entities in text and returns different types of relations that exist between them. For example, the entities "Oscar" and "Leonardo DiCaprio" might be linked by an "awardedTo" relation. To tailor results to your domain, you can specify your own custom entities and relations with custom models in Watson Knowledge Studio
get.summary: Identifies relations between entities found in text

post.description: Identifies entities in text and returns different types of relations that exist between them. For example, the entities "Oscar" and "Leonardo DiCaprio" might be linked by an "awardedTo" relation. To tailor results to your domain, you can specify your own custom entities and relations with custom models in Watson Knowledge Studio
post.summary: Identifies relations between entities found in text

get.description: Date extraction identifies dates that are mentioned in text. You can specify an anchor date to accurately interpret dates like "next tuesday."

get.description: The URLGetAuthors call is utilized to extract author information contained within the specified web page. AlchemyLanguage will download the requested URL, process the retrieved HTML document, looking for author information.
get.summary: Retrieves author information from a web page

post.description: The URLGetAuthors call is utilized to extract author information contained within the specified web page. AlchemyLanguage will download the requested URL, process the retrieved HTML document, looking for author information.
post.summary: Retrieves author information from a web page

get.description:
URLGetCombinedData lets you combine multiple AlchemyLanguage webpage operations into a single API call. Concept, keyword, entity, and taxonomy operations are performed by default if no 'extract' parameter is specified.

Any of the parameters that can be passed in the individual extract methods can be passed in a combined call, but they will apply to any applicable features that are specified in the extract parameter. For example, if you pass knowledgeGraph=1 in a combined request for concepts, entities, keywords, and relations, you will add a total of 4 extra transactions to the request.
get.summary: Analyzes a web page with multiple AlchemyLanguage operations

post.description:
URLGetCombinedData lets you combine multiple AlchemyLanguage webpage operations into a single API call. Concept, keyword, entity, and taxonomy operations are performed by default if no 'extract' parameter is specified.

Any of the parameters that can be passed in the individual extract methods can be passed in a combined call, but they will apply to any applicable features that are specified in the extract parameter. For example, if you pass knowledgeGraph=1 in a combined request for concepts, entities, keywords, and relations, you will add a total of 4 extra transactions to the request.
post.summary: Analyzes a web page with multiple AlchemyLanguage operations

get.description: The URLGetLanguage call is utilized to detect the language utilized within a given web page. AlchemyLanguage will download the requested URL, extracting text from the HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform language detection operations.
get.summary: Detects the language of a web page

post.description: The URLGetLanguage call is utilized to detect the language utilized within a given web page. AlchemyLanguage will download the requested URL, extracting text from the HTML document structure (ignoring navigation links, advertisements, and other undesirable content), and perform language detection operations.
post.summary: Detects the language of a web page

get.description: The URLGetMicroformatData call is utilized to extract structured microformats data from a given web page. AlchemyLanguage will retrieve the requested URL, process the retrieved HTML document, and look for a variety of microformat data structures (hCards, geo, adr, etc.).
get.summary: Extracts microformat data from a web page

post.description: The URLGetMicroformatData call is utilized to extract structured microformats data from a given web page. AlchemyLanguage will retrieve the requested URL, process the retrieved HTML document, and look for a variety of microformat data structures (hCards, geo, adr, etc.).
post.summary: Extracts microformat data from a web page

get.summary: Returns concepts found on a web page

get.description: The URLGetRawText call is utilized to extract all text from a web page. AlchemyLanguage will download the requested URL, extract text from the HTML document structure, including page navigation, advertisements, and other page content. To ignore this content, please use the URLGetText call.
get.summary: Extracts all text from a web page
